metadata.title: AI-based automated design for reliability of grid-connected PV inverters
metadata.author: N/A

Plan Overview
Plan Overview
A Data Management Plan created using DMPonline.be
Title: 
Title: 
AI-based automated design for reliability of grid-connected PV inverters
Creator:
Creator:
Adamou Moussa Issaka
Principal Investigator: 
Principal Investigator: 
Wilmar Martinez Martinez, n.n.
Data Manager: 
Data Manager: 
Adamou Moussa Issaka, Wilmar Martinez Martinez
Project Administrator: 
Project Administrator: 
Wilmar Martinez Martinez
Affiliation: 
Affiliation: 
KU Leuven (KUL)
Template: 
Template: 
KU Leuven BOF-IOF
Principal Investigator:
Principal Investigator:
 
Wilmar Martinez Martinez, n.n. n.n.
Data Manager:
Data Manager:
 
Adamou Moussa Issaka, Wilmar Martinez Martinez
Project abstract:
Project abstract:
This research focuses on enhancing the reliability of grid-connected photovoltaic (PV) inverters by developing a novel 
capacitorless
capacitorless
inverter topology
inverter topology
 and an AI-based control strategy. Traditional PV inverters rely on electrolytic capacitors, which are prone to failure and
significantly impact system lifespan. The proposed approach eliminates these capacitors, thereby improving durability, reducing
maintenance costs, and enhancing overall system efficiency. To achieve this, the project explores advanced control techniques using
artificial intelligence (AI)
artificial intelligence (AI)
 to compensate for the absence of capacitors while ensuring stable grid synchronization and high power quality.
The AI-based control strategy will optimize voltage regulation, mitigate power fluctuations, and enhance fault tolerance.
The research methodology includes extensive MATLAB/Simulink simulations and real-time hardware validation. By addressing key
reliability challenges, this project contributes to the development of 
longer-lasting, more efficient, and cost-effective
longer-lasting, more efficient, and cost-effective
 PV inverters for
sustainable energy systems, supporting the future of smart grids and renewable energy integration.

ID: 
214209

Start date: 
01-10-2024
End date: 
End date:

Last modified:

Data Manager: Data Manager: Adamou Moussa Issaka, Wilmar Martinez Martinez Project Administrator: Project Administrator: Wilmar Martinez Martinez Affiliation: Affiliation: KU Leuven (KUL) Template: Template: KU Leuven BOF-IOF Principal Investigator: Principal Investigator: Wilmar Martinez Martinez, n.n. n.n. Data Manager: Data Manager: Adamou Moussa Issaka, Wilmar Martinez Martinez Project abstract: Project abstract: This research focuses on enhancing the reliability of grid-connected photovoltaic (PV) inverters by developing a novel capacitorless capacitorless inverter topology inverter topology and an AI-based control strategy. Traditional PV inverters rely on electrolytic capacitors, which are prone to failure and significantly impact system lifespan. The proposed approach eliminates these capacitors, thereby improving durability, reducing maintenance costs, and enhancing overall system efficiency. To achieve this, the project explores advanced control techniques using artificial intelligence (AI) artificial intelligence (AI) to compensate for the absence of capacitors while ensuring stable grid synchronization and high power quality. The AI-based control strategy will optimize voltage regulation, mitigate power fluctuations, and enhance fault tolerance. The research methodology includes extensive MATLAB/Simulink simulations and real-time hardware validation. By addressing key reliability challenges, this project contributes to the development of longer-lasting, more efficient, and cost-effective longer-lasting, more efficient, and cost-effective PV inverters for sustainable energy systems, supporting the future of smart grids and renewable energy integration.
